poem:
Title: Lingering Truth in the Elixir of Vanity

Pity beauty's pilgrims, patiently in queue,
Their sanity fed on slick words, committed untrue.
Drink deep, the serums of deceit, sparkling and new,
Yet within, the sickness of false promise accrue.
Improvements acclaimed in glossed counting,
The lies spun as truths, never surmounting.
Regulations rouse, but vanity's price is daunting,
In the mirror, one's folly is haunting.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
